intro: Struthiola argentea var. laxior, commonly known as the silverleaf struthiola, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique leaf color and compact growth habit.
